title: TOWIE's Chloe Lewis shares a glimpse of her baby son as she holds his tiny hand
text:
She welcomed her first child with boyfriend Danny Flasher just three weeks ago.

And on Tuesday morning, TOWIE star Chloe Lewis, 28, gave her followers on Instagram another glimpse of her baby son as she posted a sweet black and white snap of herself holding his tiny hand.

In the heartwarming photograph, her newborn can be seen wearing a long-sleeved cotton ensemble with a dummy in his mouth, with his hand wrapped around his mother's thumb.

Cute! on Tuesday morning, TOWIE star Chloe Lewis, 28, gave her followers on Instagram another glimpse of her baby son as she posted a s of herself holding his tiny hand

Chloe wrote alongside: 'For all the things my hands have held, the best by far is you. I love you,' followed by a heart emoji.

The reality star shared the first picture of herself with her newborn son just over a week ago, as they enjoyed a day out shopping and lunching with her beau.

In the adorable shot, Chloe gazed down adoringly at her little boy, who was wrapped up in a cute baby grow complete with bunny ears.

The reality star captioned the snap: 'My little bundle of joy... I still can't believe you're mine. (shopping trip & lunch today with daddy).'

New parents: She welcomed her first child with boyfriend Danny Flasher just three weeks ago

So cute! The reality star shared the first picture of herself with her newborn son just over a week ago, as they enjoyed a day out shopping and lunching with her beau

Chloe took to Instagram on October 13th to announce she had welcomed her son to the world earlier this week and is 'completely besotted'.

Chloe, who announced she and boyfriend Danny were expecting their first child back in May, revealed last month she had been expecting twins but tragically lost one baby eight weeks into her pregnancy.

The reality star shared the first photo of her newborn son and wrote: 'Earlier this week our baby boy arrived. We are completely besotted & so so in LOVE.'

Chloe decided to take a photo of her baby boy's feet, with his white baby grow visible as he lay on a blanket. She is yet to reveal his name.

Exciting: Chloe gave birth to her first child, a baby boy, earlier this month

In May, Chloe announced her pregnancy alongside an image of an ultrasound and the reveal date of '05.22.19', which she captioned: 'Half me, half you ♥️'.

The couple decided to not find out the sex of the baby prior to giving birth because they wanted it to be a surprise.

Last month, Chloe revealed she had been expecting twins but had suffered a miscarriage at eight weeks pregnant.

The reality star only found out she was carrying twins after going to the doctor when she was worried about the bleeding.

Oh, baby! Taking to Instagram in May, Chloe delighted fans by announcing her pregnancy alongside an image of an ultrasound and the reveal date of '05.22.19'

After waking in the middle of the night to find she was bleeding, Chloe went to a private doctor, fearing she had miscarried.

A scan showed two fetuses in the womb, but the doctor warned that only one was visible, meaning she was unlikely to be able to carry the baby to full term.

'I told her about the bleeding and she said that I probably had lost it,' Chloe told OK! magazine.

'The doctor did confirm the twins had been identical. That was so sad for me to hear. I kept thinking this one is going to come out and they would have looked exactly the same.'

Loss: Ahead of her birth, Chloe revealed she had been expecting twins but had suffered a miscarriage at eight weeks pregnant

Excited: Chloe kept her followers updated on her pregnancy journey. Back in July she shared a prenatal scan showed a high-definition, moving 4D image of her baby inside her stomach

Chloe added that she found her mixed emotions hard to cope with, admitting: 'I grieved for about three months. I felt like I had gone into a hole, like I had lost a child. I felt like I had done something wrong because it was my body.

'Was I going to the gym too much? You start questioning yourself,' she explained. It wasn't until Danny said, "Chloe, you've got to snap out of this, you've got one healthy baby, not everyone gets this."'

'I was supposed to be happy but I was sad because I'd lost one. I was happy some days and sad others.

'I couldn't be totally happy. After three months, though, I said to myself, 'Right, you've got to sort yourself out.'''

Can't wait to see you! Chloe Lewis celebrated her pregnancy in style last month, throwing a lavish baby shower for her closest friends and family

Chloe and Essex banker Danny have been in a relationship for two years, and while she likes to keep their romance out of the reality TV spotlight, she often treat fans to loved-up pictures from their romantic getaways.

The former model rose to fame on ITVBe's The Only Way Is Essex in 2015, where fans witnessed the demise of her seven-year romance with ex Jake Hall, who is now engaged to RHOC's Missé Bequiri.

Chloe recently revealed she's walked away from the reality TV for good as she 'outgrew' the series after years of being filled with 'stress and anxiety' over her past relationship.

She also stressed the difficulty in juggling life in front of the TV with her personal relationship.
description: In the heartwarming black and white snap shared to Instagram, the TOWIE star's son can be seen with a dummy in his mouth, with his hand wrapped around his mother's thumb
